benchmark_details.name: EgoInstruct (Egocentric Video Dataset of Face-to-face Instructional Interactions)
benchmark_details.overview: A new egocentric video dataset of face-to-face instruction that provides ground-truth annotations for procedural step segmentation and conversation-state classification.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a foundation for the analysis of face-to-face instructional interactions through a new dataset and benchmark models for understanding instructional effectiveness.

data.source: Recorded video sessions of face-to-face instructional interactions using Aria Glasses and GoPro cameras.
data.annotation: Annotations for procedural step segmentation and conversation-state classification.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on segmentation precision and classifications of conversation states.
methodology.interpretation: High scores indicate good performance on recognizing procedural steps and accurate detection of conversation states.
methodology.baseline_results: ASFormer and conventional task-specific models were used for comparison.
methodology.validation: Five-fold cross-validation was conducted for model evaluations.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Participants' consent obtained; identity anonymized in annotations.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Explicit consent was taken from all participants involved in the video recordings.
